website_summaries.verdict: The incredibly strong Jump'N Jack is a fantastic interactive feeder toy, a fetch toy, and a chew toy, making it a jack of all trades.
pros: Insert peanut butter, food, or treats and watch them work hard to get it
Scrapes plaque from teeth as they play
Available in small, medium, and large sizes

customer_reviews.title: Fun short term distraction, but could be dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy really liked this toy but its not strong enough for constant chewing. After a few days he was able to rip large chunks off which was SUPER dangerous, he ended up throwing them up. Its a great distraction for an hour or so but dont let medium-large or strong chewers keep it all the time. Also note, this thing gets gross really fast if you dont wash the treat goo out of the channels after each use, and many other common treats dont fit inside the hole and it just goes straight through. Dog loves the unpredictable bouncing. Lasted about a month of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: The GeekFreek

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with it at all
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with this Kong product at all. I only buy Kong because of how durable they are, because my almost 2 year old dog can literally eat all the other toys in minutes. I checked all over before I bought it and I stupidly thought since it was Kong I didn't need to read the customer reviews. Had I, I then would have known not to waste my money. His Christmas present lasted not even 12 minutes before he had chunks ate off of it. To say that I'm disappointed is really an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: HR McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a Miss ... Makes a Mess
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this kong. My dog loves it but it works better in theory than it does in actual real life (where I currently reside). The ridges on the outside are made for smearing peanut butter or some other spreadable goodness into but then my dog decides she needs to roll it all over the living room carpet before she can eat it .... now the dogs won't stop licking the living room floor. I could spread the peanut butter in and then freeze the Kong but if I had time for that when would I have time to write reviews nobody will ever pay attention to?
customer_reviews.author: WES M

customer_reviews.title: Did not last!
customer_reviews.text: I had such high expectations with the Kong name but our Lab is chewing chunks of it off every time he plays with it. I have looked for one in black as I understand they are of a denser material but haven't found one. He loves it but I just can't have him tearing it apart or swollowing pieces. I have had other Kong products that have held up great. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Literally the best dog toy ever
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this is the best dog toy ever made in my opinion for a number of reasons one seemingly indestructible because it's made of very quality materials number two because of the shape it allows it to bounce in different directions thus allowing a new trajectory every bounce which keeps my dog active and she can even throw it around all by herself. So I can absolutely say without a shadow of a doubt that Kong is most definitely my favorite brand for dog toys impeccable durability, smart design... plus they cover all of the dog stages: puppy to senior AND all size dogs. Hats off to the toy KING... KONG. Another incredible product.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthless Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Some Kong toys are great, but not this model
customer_reviews.text: For a teething puppy maybe, but the rubber is way too flexible on this for a dog with adult teeth. The Kong toys I’ve purchased in the past, lasted. This thing didn’t even last 20minutes. My dog chewed off two sides and had the others dangling. Thankfully he didn’t swallow any large pieces that broke off. But def not worth the buy. I had to double check this was Kong brand because it was the first Kong toy we bought fell apart this quickly. Disappointing. I wouldn’t say don’t buy Kong toys because we love our other Kong toys, but I wouldn’t recommend this particular one. Should be redesigned with more sturdy rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as the traditional "bell" shaped Kong toy
customer_reviews.text: The shape is great for playing fetch with as it bounces in unpredictable directions. Our six month old puppy loved that. However, if your dog is a chewer it is much less durable than the traditional "bell" shaped toy. Our lab puppy completely chewed this apart in less than a day (and she still didn't have all her permanent teeth in at the time). On the aside, she also chewed the medium size traditional "bell" shaped black Kong apart in a few hours, but she hasn't been able to take apart the largest red one yet. So if you do have a power chewer I recommend buying larger toys.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Chipped teeth
customer_reviews.text: So my Tucker is about 30 pounds or so but is a tougher chewer than my sister's pit mix who in her prime was pure muscle. He has chipped two teeth on those hard plastic toys that are the dog equivalent of Legos. He would chew for hours it felt like. Well when we found out about his teeth we took them away to prevent more damage. We got a few of the kong toys and after a few days he didn't even notice he lost the others. He loves these and so do I! No spikey chewed up plastic everywhere, no more chipped teeth, and most importantly a happy puppy. This one is his absolute favorite toy now!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Smells incredibly bad!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 4 month old puppy and before even opening the package I could smell it. It smells like it was stored in zoo urine (hopefully zoo's don't store urine lol). I even purchased another one thinking it was a fluke, but it too smelled exactly the same. Had to leave them outside to off gas and while the smell has lessened, it's still quite stinky. I was going to return them, but my dogs love them. Watching to be sure they're not toxic, but so far no issues besides stink.
customer_reviews.author: Polliwog

customer_reviews.title: A nice fun toy for medium-small dogs.  Not for big dogs or strong jaws.
customer_reviews.text: Toy is fun for the dog, and she likes it. It bounces unpredictably, and it helps to keep her attention. Have not tried putting treats in it yet. Careful, what they call "large" is about the diameter of a soft-ball, so maybe for dogs under 40lbs. My dog is only 60lbs and can almost fit the whole thing in her mouth. The rubber seems a bit soft, so I don't think it will last long as my dog is a heavy chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.J

customer_reviews.title: Very soft for a kong toy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the reviews because of the Kong brand. I put regular food in it for our 13 lb. Shih-Tzu and he chewed off a corner of it. He never has damaged any of his toys in his 3 1/2 years even his soft fluffy toys. I think the quality is not up to the Kong toy brand.
customer_reviews.author: E Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not strong for Power Chewers
customer_reviews.text: My one year old husky loves her regular Kong so I bought this thinking it would be good for her teeth. She had this for less than one hour and chewed non stop and has gotten large chunks off of it. A lot of money for something to last such a short time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chaides

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Well I wish I would of depended on the reviews more so then just the name of the product. I have never been disappointed with a Kong brand toy. I have a GSD and he has yet to destroy one up until today. This toy was literally just delivered and is already in pieces and in the trash. He is not an obsessive heavy chewer but the excitement of a new toy kept him busy all of 20mins before I had to toss it because the small pieces he chewed off could result is a hefty vet bill. I do not recommend this toy for any size dog considering the poor craftsmanship could result in danger for your pup.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves to chew! Lasted longer than most toys - 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My 90 pound "puppy" recently turned 12 months. He has destroyed so many "indestructible" chew toys. He loved the Jump'N Jack and I probably will buy him another and put it away when I'm not there to supervise. It lasted for two months and that is pretty good for him. He's a Lab/Red Nose Pit x something big. Considering what he does to knuckle bones, etc the toy lasted for a long time. Too bad there isn't an X-Large available.
customer_reviews.author: kittyhawk2

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Dog had it 5 min. Tore it apart. Dangerous. Returning. I am a big Kong customer too. This is a first.
customer_reviews.author: CGE

customer_reviews.title: Happy Boxer, Happy Mom!
customer_reviews.text: Our boxer plays with this toy everyday. He really likes it. We needed to replace a toy he had started to chew through and shred. This was just the thing we needed. He has been chewing the heck out of this for months now and it shows no signs of wear. Thank you! Update: Still going strong with this toy! Our dog's favorite! Has a split on one of the sides but daily chewing, tugging, and fetching has not work it out. Will be buying this again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Detective Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for fetching not sturdy as a chew toy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty soft rubber that my young lab loves fetching. Great for throwing and bouncing around, my lab is a "heavy" chewer, so he takes chunks out of it quickly if you leave it out for him to use as a chew toy. I recommend as a fetch toy only (put it out of reach when finishing playing) and use the other sturdier toys as a chew toy if you have a "heavy" chewer like myself.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Chewed up in Less than Five Minutes
customer_reviews.text: We got this because our mid-sized dog’s favorite toy in the world is a red Kong Ball that looks similar to this. He loves to chase and also chew endlessly on that. But when we gave him this, the fact that he could get his teeth around the ends made this a five-minute destructible toy. Disappointed but he still loves the Kong ball.
customer_reviews.author: buyer1

customer_reviews.title: Love this and will be buying more!!
customer_reviews.text: So glad we got this!!!! Our dog has been obsessed with this toy ever since we bought it. He tears up anything fluffy so this has been doing a great job with durability! It’s nice too bc when we throw it, it doesn’t bounce all over the house- and it’s gentle for our tile floors. Highly highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa A.

customer_reviews.title: Threw out same day
customer_reviews.text: Most KONG toys hold up against my 1 year old Lab, but I had to throw this toy away the same day I got it. It started breaking apart almost immediately. Don't buy if you have a strong chewer!
customer_reviews.author: Peter E.

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy chew toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog, a 56 lb. Jack Russell Catahoula hound had 2 of those extensions chewed to crumbs in about 10 minutes when I left the room. She is a chewer and we have 2 other Kong toys, the ball for hidden treats and the medium Kong classic hollow triple ball and neither has been destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: lkoussan

customer_reviews.title: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS IF YOU HAVE A CHEWER
customer_reviews.text: Well made up to the Kong standard. I have a two year old pit bull mix that chews EVERYTHING and we've had this nine months and he hasn't damaged it in the least. Jam treats down into the slots or holes and it keeps him occupied for over an hour trying to get it out. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS IF YOU HAVE A CHEWER.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. May

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with kong easy treat. Loaded it up as soon as I got it. I laughed and enjoyed watching my dog lick and suck and chase this toy. Then he started chewing and well... he destroyed two of the prongs. I had to clean up the little rubber pieces to keep him from swallowing them. This toy lasted about 6 hours. Kong said their warranty isn't for this toy and that they wouldn't reimburse or replace. So I feel like I wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hancock

customer_reviews.title: because they always seem to make stuff that they like. I didn't think my dog would like this
customer_reviews.text: I think Kong does a lot of research with dogs, because they always seem to make stuff that they like. I didn't think my dog would like this, but he actually does. It's not his favorite, but he takes it out occasionally. He seems to like the noises it makes when he tries to chew it.
customer_reviews.author: DPD1

customer_reviews.title: Durable should not be the first word in the product description. Red Kong material not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I read a review that said this Kong rated very high on a durability scale. I beg to differ, one hour after I gave this to our black lab puppy she had chewed it down to nubs as you can see. Red Kong material clearly is less than durable. Unfortunately, this turned out to be a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great puppy toy
customer_reviews.text: Good toy that bounces every direction for fetch. Great for my teething puppy to keep him engaged and also the groves design was soothing for his gums to chew on and easy for him to hold. He slept with it for a while to ease teething pain throughout the night, which meant the humans could sleep better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best chew toy we've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This toy takes about 3 minutes to set up. We add four pieces of kibble and four small treats, as well as a little peanut butter. Our beautiful little Corgi then works at it for at least 30 minutes, sometimes longer. Because of the small amount of kibble and treats, we can give it to him a few times a day. All other similar activity toys have taken 10 minutes to set up and 3 minutes for him to find all the treats.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ann Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Three quick strikes and out!
customer_reviews.text: It was minutes, not hours before pieces were chewed off the ends by the royal hound. The ridges afforded easy access for the canine teeth. Kong makes great products, but this one is flawed, and to be avoided if you have a heavy chewer.
customer_reviews.author: NumbersBand15-60-75

customer_reviews.title: Throw it at the park and watch the fun.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best non-ball toys out there for unpredictable directional patterns. This is great because it simulates a hunt for your pupper and no toss is the same. It’s mentally and physically stimulating and durable too! I’ve got a ACD and a GSD/Ridgeback who haven’t ruined this yet. You can also smear peanut butter and boiled chicken mixture in the cracks and then freeze it for some non-throwing action too.
customer_reviews.author: Julie333Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I’d like
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t long before little red pieces started falling off ):
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best reward ever!
customer_reviews.text: We try to give our dog something before we leave. This JumpN’ Jack Kong is perfect. I tried filling the groves with peanut butter or the canned Kong’s cheese but she did not get the stuff out and got bored. Now I put kibble in the groves and she loves it! No more separation anxiety with this!
customer_reviews.author: katefur

customer_reviews.title: Still holding up to our Doberman's bite
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our adult "chew-crazy" Doberman. He loves it and hasn't been able to destroy it yet! The odd shape of it makes it bounce in random directions, which is great for keeping him entertained when we can't be outside with him, as it keeps him guessing which way to go. I recommend sticking only dry kibble/treats into the grooves, as they can get VERY dirty and trying to clean it out properly is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Jumping jack flash
customer_reviews.text: If you want entertainment. When this thing bounces it goes wild. My dog is so attached its not funny. When she needs to chew it holds up. 2 weeks and noy even a tooth mark. Very flexible. Has holes for treats for puzzle games. Sturdy and inexpensive
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small size as I have a small breed dog (Lhasapoo) and now a puppy (Boxer mix). It is about the size of a tennis ball. Overall this is a neat toy and my dogs like it. At first I didn't see the ends lasting very long because they seemed a tad flimsy, but the toy has held up great. My Boxer puppy can destroy toys with ease but has yet to break any piece of this, his favorite, toy apart.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: My puppy's favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is my puppy's favorite toy! (10 week old Lab.) For some reason, she has no interested in the regular Kong. I load this with a portion of her dry food for the day and she is set! The grooves hold pieces of her dog food perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Pitbull vs Toy
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was great that this toy gave my dog the satisfaction on his teeth sinking in. However he had it in pieces within 30 minutes. It bounced so erratically it is a shame he destroyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as other KONG products
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up to my dogs chewing like other KONG products. This one lasted about an hour of chewing before my dog was able to start taking chunks out of it. If your dog is a chewer, then I recommend looking at the other KONG products.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Expensive chew toy that didn’t make it 20 minutes...
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old dog isn’t an aggressive chewer but chewed off the edge within 20 minutes. We have other Kong items that he doesn’t show interest in so I’m not sure what happened with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jen G

customer_reviews.title: One tough toy!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I have been going through toys with my Yellow Lab left and right. He could probably chew through steel cable. He would sit there and just tear things apart. He even destroyed a Kong Classic! I got this and it really is awesome! He loves the way it bounces around I can still smear peanut butter into the cracks for him, it tends to keep his teeth clean and he has not yet after a few weeks of trying, been able to destroy it! I definitely would recommend this for destructive dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin R.

customer_reviews.title: Puppy got pieces off this thing in no time
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this because it was advertised to be a stronger version of a Kong Puppy toy that my 4 month old Bernese Mountain dog loved but was tearing apart. Unfortunately, he quickly got pieces off of this one with the supposedly stronger material in no time, causing chunks of the rubber to break off which could be a choking hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Marybeth F.

customer_reviews.title: It jumps, but what comes out?
customer_reviews.text: The holes - so tiny that even the tiny dog kibble pieces didn’t fit inside until I “broke” them apart-ish. My pup likes it when the crumbs fall out but I can’t really fit anything inside. Never *mind* a few scoops of peanut butter. Maybe if I did canned cheese for her, it would work. But I don’t (yet?) so it is kinda worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a challenging chewer
customer_reviews.text: This toy has turned out to be a household favorite. The dog loves it. It bounces when we throw it for her, and she entertains herself tossing it in the air and then retrieving it. There must be something enjoyable about the chewing experience too. We've never put food in it but it's the chew toy she prefers. We love it because it's one of the few toys that has stood up to her very vigorous chewing. She can destroy chew toys in minutes - even the "indestructible" ones but this one has lasted through weeks of heavy use and looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Chris 6000

customer_reviews.title: Great stimulation for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: KONG makes great products! This is great for chewers. My dogs love chewing in all of the nooks and crannies for the last morsel of peanut butter I slather in there. I also wedge dog treats between the ridges and in the small holes, works wonders when I'm trying to get stuff done around the house uninterrupted. Very durable! No tears or pieces broken off. I own two corgis under 40lbs, but my friend has a 60lb Golden Doodle with this same product and there hasn't been any tears/pieces yet and they've had it for months.
customer_reviews.author: CHELSEA L MEREDITH

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy! He chewed on it for hours after I gave it to him. It's the perfect size for a small dog, soft enough to chew on and yet hard enough to be durable and last awhile. it bounces on the carpet and yet will not leave a mark on any wall that it hits. Highly recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another favorite for my Doberman
customer_reviews.text: We have had several of Kongs and our dog loves them. You wouldn’t believe how excited she got when the package arrived, we opened it up and handed it to her. Her tail wags, she runs around showing it off, and starts chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: S & T. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t hold up for even 1 day.
customer_reviews.text: My dog (GSD) chewed one of extensions completely off the large sized toy in 2 hours and put a big crack in another extension of the toy. Dogs are going to chew with their back teeth on the extension arms. They don’t hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT. Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I have a 19 lb shitzu and this was being ripped up and pieces all over my living room Within 5 minutes of giving it to her......
customer_reviews.author: Erin Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to chew pieces off it.
customer_reviews.text: Item did not hold up well. My Weimaraner chewed pieces from it right away. Pieces could be swallowed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR EXTREME CHEWERS
customer_reviews.text: I know Kong is suppose to be durable, which their other products have but the jack kong is not one of them. My 65lb shepherd ate pieces off in 5 minutes of having it. I don’t recommend for extreme chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tough chewers
customer_reviews.text: So far this toy has survived 2 Dalmatian pups, 1 mastiff pup and a adult tough chewing mastiff. Amazing. Great fir puppies that grew everything. Mine live the squeeze it has. I love that it lasts. Buying more!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for a chew session
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely not for chewing sessions. My 10 month old 13 pound dog destroyed this toy. Definitely not worth the money. Thankfully my dog was able to vomit and pass the rubber! I’m so annoyed!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Shhh!  Don't tell!
customer_reviews.text: My second one over 2 years for a power chewer Shepherd. The previous one is still going, but showing wear. Saving this new one for Christmas. Don't tell him! It's amazing with peanut butter on it for keeping him happy for quite a while. It has so many surfaces to hide the yummy stuff that he works at it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Usually the red Kong means that they won’t destroy it quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Usually the red Kong means that they won’t destroy it quickly. If your dog is a chewer this product will be destroyed within a couple hours. My dog isn’t that big and is a jack Russell, pit mix. The problem is that toys are expensive and if your dog eats $15 a day in toys I don’t think that works well with anyone’s bank account.
customer_reviews.author: Leor Levi

customer_reviews.title: ... of these for my german shephards and they absolutely love them. They are one of their favorite toys-well ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my german shephards and they absolutely love them. They are one of their favorite toys-well made and even my german shephards can't do any damage to them. they are still in the same condition they were when I bought them even though they play and chew on them daily. I alway buy kong products for my dogs since I know they are well made and won't hurt my dogs. And the bounce on these things is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: MY 7 month old destroys all toys.. but not this one!
customer_reviews.text: He Loves It and Can't Destroy It!! Our pit/lab mix who is 7 months old destroys all toys.. so it's rare to find one that he loves, that will not be so hard that I worry about his teeth, yet it holds up to the aggressive chewing. When we throw it, it bounces in all different directions which he loves, and the groves in the toy definitely help to keep his teeth clean. I strongly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: BKW Family

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A Dog Toy My Dog Doesn't Destroy in 5 Minutes!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog could chew through a steel chain if he really wanted to (not that is ever do that!). This means that he can literally destroy about 98% of the 'indestructible' toys out there. This is a problem because if I leave him unsupervised he will chew and swallow the pieces as he tears it apart. Before this toy, I had to use the blue toy (can't remember the maker) that's been discontinued. Even then, it was about $25 and he still ran through it in a matter of a couple months. This toy he hasn't even put the slightest dent in yet after about 6 months!!
customer_reviews.author: PMP

customer_reviews.title: Red Kongs suck for hard chewers.
customer_reviews.text: I guess it was my mistake for ordering a red Kong. It did not make 5 minutes with my dog. She had it torn to pieces. I literally got it today. What a waste of money. If you have hard chewers, the red Kobgs are not for you or me.
customer_reviews.author: cheryljessen

customer_reviews.title: Kong Jump N Jack isn't for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I found very small pieces from this toy that our 8 mo. old Aussie puppy had managed to chew. The pieces did go through his system but I wouldn't recommend this toy for chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Hunsaker

customer_reviews.title: Great toy might not be for every mutt...
customer_reviews.text: All Kong toys are well made and meant to survive even the roughest of mutts. The mutt I bought this for likes it but it seems there are only a few toys she keeps going back to all the time. One being an original Kong. This is still a great toy and has places for inserting food or snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Best toy in the world
customer_reviews.text: Best toy in the world! I love all the KONG dog toys, but we have two of these for our Lab and will always have one on hand. He loves, loves to fetch this even more than a ball or Frisbee. We bounce it off steps or the sidewalk or simply throw so he can catch it in mid-air. Best exercise toy ever! Yes,Yes, yes...I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: tuffyd

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our medium size golden doodle and she has already taken chunks out of it. She usually does well with Kong toy but this one is not holding up as well. If you have a chewer...this is not the toy for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Interactive and fun toy for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a super aggressive chewer and this thing has stood up to her jaws. She loves to chance and chew on this toy and since it is in the jack shaoe it bounces uniquely and has varying travel patches which keeps your dog on their toes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Andrew Ventry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I have two scotties who love the jumpin' jacks! They tend to wolf down other treats without chewing, so I am reluctant to give them anything. The jumpin' jack is a great alternative. I spread peanut butter in the grooves, and they keep busy working it all back out again. They ask for their daily treat after dinner, so it's a happy way to end our day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a tough, strong,fun,a little soft, jittery jumpy toy
customer_reviews.text: well its Kong for a start, that means well made & thought out for my dog, we don't use the treat part as its not needed, my 2 year old standard 46 pound Schnauzer has about 12 or 15 toys, all of which are his favorite every day, but jump'N Jack gets a good part of the day every day, i new in advance it was a good toy, but had no idea my dog would like it nearly as much as he does
customer_reviews.author: old man mike bengyak

customer_reviews.title: Not a good toy for a Pitbull.
customer_reviews.text: I received it very quickly. However the product itself is not the Kong quality I am used to. I have bought many Kong products because I have a Pit-bull and Kong balls seem to be the ONLY ball that can handle his mouth or bite. This toy is being ripped apart extremely extremely quick. This may work for another big dog but NOT a pitbull. If I could, I would ask for a refund but its already been ripped apart by my dog.
customer_reviews.author: 7Nate2

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with Kong - I thought they were sturdy and ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog, a golden retriever, chewed on this for about five minutes and proceeded to bite bits of it off. Very disappointed with Kong - I thought they were sturdy and durable!
customer_reviews.author: Jay L

customer_reviews.title: My 5-pound dog chewed pieces after the first 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: My 5-pound dog chewed pieces after the first 2 hours. It’s very disappointing. Usually Kong has very durable toys, but this one is a let go.
customer_reviews.author: D. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile rubber toy
customer_reviews.text: Well made as Kong rubber toys are and Made in the USA. My dog loves to fetch it as it bounces erratically, and also enjoys his regular dry dog food when placed into the deeper slits, since his food is flat. (Some slits are shallower) He likes to play with it, pulling each piece out and working at it and then chewing on the kibble and then also the toy. It is the perfect size for my 9 lb. Havanese too. He is past his puppy teething when he only had the regular red rubber Kong, and I wish I had it sooner, but it still is a toy he likes as I described above.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog toy to freeze with treats. Our dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog trainer recommended this toy for our husky/shepherd mix. She suggested we put peanut butter on it, freeze it and use it for the dog to have something to lick at throughout the day. It has been a big hit with the dog. She absolutely loves it with the frozen treat in it. I have noticed she's chewed off a little at the edges so if you have a very aggressive chewer/licker it may not be a good fit. I just make sure I keep an eye on her and when she's licked it clean I take it from her so she doesn't chew it apart. It's a nice item to have in rotation use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gouker

customer_reviews.title: tough and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the toys that my pit and one of my labs love to carry around. my puppy lab loves to chew on it. Has lasted pretty well and I don't know think my destroyers will be able to destroy it.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Tom

customer_reviews.title: My pup has the most awesome fun with this toy
customer_reviews.text: My pup has the most awesome fun with this toy. It never bounces the same way twice! She loves "eating" it and this has become her new fav. She carries it around in her mouth like she's sucking on a pacifier. It goes everywhere with her!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great Kong toy
customer_reviews.text: My basset usually tears up toys in 5 minutes. Not this one! He loves chewing on it and tossing it. It bounces randomly so he’s really entertained by it. The intense chewing on it for over a month hasn’t damaged it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Good treat dispensing toy
customer_reviews.text: This is great for sticking all sorts of treats and food inside... however it is not so great when it comes to cleaning the more gooey and sticky types of food. It is also limiting as to what exactly you can put inside this and actually make is possible for your dog to get the treat back out.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudy in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great durable chew and throw toy. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog and my moms dogs favorite. He is a heavy chewer and has not demolished this one yet, and it’s been months. Best toy ever. My moms is a puppy and likes chewing. I don’t put anything on it, and it jumps around and is good for play time. I think this one is good for their teeth and gums. Definitely a great dog toy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: They shed rubber pieces
customer_reviews.text: Both the small and large Kong Jump N Jack Dental dog toy shed small rubber pieces off their edges when even lightly chewed on. This could create a chocking hazard for the dog. Both the kong chew toys had to be thrown away. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Alt

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT chew Toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (2 rottweilers and a Sheltie) absolutely LOVE this toy. They are always fighting over it. When one of them chews on it, you can definitely hear the slobber coming out of their mouth. They have had this toy for 2 months now and it's still going strong! KONG is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Wales

customer_reviews.title: For a Kong product, it didn’t last long!
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador took a chunk out of it within a couple of minutes
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: great toy for Husky puppies
customer_reviews.text: this is a great toy I love that when tossed it bounces all different directions also when she chews on it I can tell it feels good on her puppy teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Not durable like other KONG toys
customer_reviews.text: Our family LOVES KONG products, but I'm thinking the rubber component on this toy in particular was not thick enough, my 3 year old German Shep just chewed the ends off so easily. The toy was pulled from him within 5 minutes. I was hoping it to have the same thickness/durability as the KONG dental stick - which is AMAZING! But this one was just too weak unfortunately. We will continue to purchase OTHER Kong products, but this one is forever on my "do not buy again" list.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: not durable
customer_reviews.text: It took Oliver about ten minutes to have this Kong toy chewed into bits. I look for toys for tough chewers, but I am often disappointed in the products. This one is not so tough.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline R.

customer_reviews.title: Best toy for large dogs who love to chew
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this toy. We have a 115 black lab retriever and this is his favorite toy. It’s the only thing he can’t destroy. The only reason we have purchased new ones is when we lose it. 5 stars ⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Texasbrat

customer_reviews.title: which the dog loved. However 5 minutes into playing with this toy
customer_reviews.text: It bounces around in all sorts of directions, which the dog loved. However 5 minutes into playing with this toy, he ate half of one extension. If your pup is anything like my australian shepherd, THE ONLY toy that will make it past a few hrs of playtime is the kong tire that you stick treats into.
customer_reviews.author: Vnesteren

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It's a soft-ish rubber, which splintered and produced small pieces that could potentially cause intestinal blockages if swallowed. It had to be taken away from the dog in just minutes because it became obvious that it was a health hazard. Poorly designed because the ridges that will hold treats like peanut butter or kibble are the pieces that break off and become dangerous shards.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hulsey

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband took this toy with him to work for his dog that he takes with him everyday. Its a great hard rubber toy that helps clean teeth and his dog doesn't have to worry about the other dogs taking it away like other toys.
customer_reviews.author: TX-MoM.

customer_reviews.title: Not for teething
customer_reviews.text: This item lasted less than a day before my dog had chewed and eaten most of it. She is a Border Collie and not a barracuda. I truly expected much more from this product. I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Warren

customer_reviews.title: don't give this to a chewer
customer_reviews.text: this is supposed to be tough but dog went right thru it
customer_reviews.author: Katey Humling

customer_reviews.title: "Durable"???
customer_reviews.text: My dog tore off one of the stubs and shredded red plastic within 10 minutes of receiving her new toy. Less durable than a dollar-store toy!
customer_reviews.author: SMPDphoto

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as the regular Kongs
customer_reviews.text: I use Kongs to fill them and freeze them and I don't let my dogs chew on them after they have finished going after the frozen filling so I was disappointed that only after 1 or 2 times my dog has bitten the ends off of this.
customer_reviews.author: DIY'R

customer_reviews.title: Dogs loved it, but...
customer_reviews.text: it didn't last long. I guess my Cavalier King Charles Spaniel is too aggressive of a chewer. She was eating pieces of it within a half hour. My Japanese Chin liked chasing it, especially the way it bounced unpredictably when tossed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It's a fun toy to watch bounce if I throw it on ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun toy to watch bounce if I throw it on hard floor like tile or cement. However I didn't find it to be as useful for my dog as other puzzle and challenge games simply because the spaces for treats are pretty thin. I put peanut butter and coconut oil on this and of course my dog love it but it serves the job as just a licking toy. My dog didn't really get any energy out of her...
customer_reviews.author: zoshes

customer_reviews.title: Good toy in our arsenal
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Kong toy for a 50 lb lab mix who lives to chew. We have several other Kong toys, including the standard red rubber and at least one of the black rubber toys. This is a good toy to keep her attention, and while she hasn't destroyed it, it is the only one of our Kong toys to show wear. She has been able to chew bits off the corners as she "works on it". Still, we are pleased with this toy and all the crevices that allow for treat insertion. I would recommend this for supervised use by your dog.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, bad execution
customer_reviews.text: It took ten minutes for my herding dog to chew off and eat small pieces of this toy. He absolutely loved it for the ten minutes he had it though. The toy shape is fun because it bounces oddly which my dog found fascinating. However, it is not for powerful chewers as they can quickly chew through the ridges on the outside of the toy. On the bright side, Kong Company was very responsive and the Kong material easily passed through my dog's system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer BaT

customer_reviews.title: Strong dog toy
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a toy our dog didn't chew up within hours. However, he doesn't seem to like the taste. It's fun to throw and watch him chase after in the random pattern, as the Kong bounces back and forth. It's not a favorite at our house. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: LWM

customer_reviews.title: $3,000 mistake
customer_reviews.text: Came apart and my dog swallowed a huge chunk that got stuck in his intestine. Over $3,000 dollars later my bulldog is recovering after his surgery.
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: Super Chewer Approved
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST of the KONG toys. Firstly, he loves the shape. Second, he's 8mth old 80lbs and really really chews on this thing. I have checked it numerous times for damage and for as much as he works on this toy the only thing he managed to eat was the very end edges where the groves are cut away. Kong toys are the only toy that stands up to his chewing, because of Kong toys my furniture is intact. This one is a super winner.
customer_reviews.author: jenniferlivengood

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After many great Kong chew toys standing up to the chewing of an 8 month old Lab, the ends on this Jack were chewed off in 10 minutes. A dental toy, definitely NOT!! Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Edmondson-Trost

customer_reviews.title: they are a lot of fun. This particular toy is not one that I ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog adores these toys. Unfortunately, she adores them so much that she tries to turn them in to food. They do not hold up against strong chewers at all. She loves to turn them in to tiny little pieces. However, until she destroys them, they are a lot of fun. This particular toy is not one that I will leave her alone very long with as she destroys this one way too easily.She loves them though. I just wish they were a bit cheaper since $10-$20 for toys that only last a couple of weeks is a bit ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy! My teething lab puppy loves it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy! My teething lab puppy loves it! I stick small treats in the slots in the sides and he goes crazy ttying to get them out. Holds his small attention span for a hours. Great to throw around outside. It bounces every which way and really makes him work to get it. Extremely durable material. This toy is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The dog loves it. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.text: The dog loves it. When you roll it along the floor, out wobbles in different directions which the dog thinks is fun. Made is USA.
customer_reviews.author: Rick from South Florida

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love Kong
customer_reviews.text: I really like that it’s got the grooves in it because that helps massage their gums and that’s good for teeth health . Plus the “Jack” design makes it roll around. My dogs love Kong and they are pretty durable I’ll probably get another one so they don’t fight over it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen U

product_meta.title: KONG Jump N Jack Dental Dog Toy
product_meta.description: Size:LargeThe KONG Jump'N Jack has a fun bounce and unique design that's great for chew sessions. The Denta-Ridges reduce plaque while providing a gentle cleaning and conditioning of teeth and gums. Fill the Denta-Ridges with Easy Treat or Peanut Butter to extend playtime and satisfy chewing instincts. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: DURABILITY: The natural KONG Classic red rubber formula is created to be durable and satisfy your dog's natural chewing instincts. Provides an erratic bounce for fetch and chase fun.
GREAT FOR STUFFING: The KONG Dental Stick is even more enticing and can extend playtime when the center and Denta-Ridges are stuffed with KONG Easy Treat and Snacks.
TEETH CLEANING: The strategically designed Denta-Ridges help to clean teeth and gums for improved dental hygiene.
LARGE DOGS: Made for large dogs size 30-65 lbs (13-30 kg)
MADE IN THE USA. Globally Sourced Materials.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
